verses.verse: When Yitro <S%H3503><s%>, the Kohen <S%H3548><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%>, Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, heard <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of all that 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> for Mosheh <S%H4872><s%>, and for Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%> his people <S%H5971><s%>, and that the YY <S%H3068><s%> had brought <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8689><s%> Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%> out of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>;

Then Yitro <S%H3503><s%>, Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, took <S%H3947><s%> <S%H8799><s%> TZipporah <S%H6855><s%>, Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' wife <S%H802><s%>, after <S%H310><s%> he had sent her back <S%H7964><s%>,

And her two <S%H8147><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%>; of which the name <S%H8034><s%> of the one <S%H259><s%> was Gershom <S%H1647><s%>; for he said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, I have been an alien <S%H1616><s%> in a strange <S%H5237><s%> land <S%H776><s%>:

And the name <S%H8034><s%> of the other <S%H259><s%> was Eliezer <S%H461><s%>; for the 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%>, said he, was mine help <S%H5828><s%>, and delivered <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me from the sword <S%H2719><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>:

And Yitro <S%H3503><s%>, Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, came <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with his sons <S%H1121><s%> and his wife <S%H802><s%> unto Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> into the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, where he encamped <S%H2583><s%> <S%H8802><s%> at the mount <S%H2022><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>:

And he said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto Mosheh <S%H4872><s%>, I thy father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%> Yitro <S%H3503><s%> am come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8802><s%> unto thee, and thy wife <S%H802><s%>, and her two <S%H8147><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> with her.

And Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to meet <S%H7125><s%> <S%H8800><s%> his father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, and did obeisance <S%H7812><s%> <S%H8691><s%>, and kissed <S%H5401><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him; and they asked <S%H7592><s%> <S%H8799><s%> each <S%H376><s%> other <S%H7453><s%> of their welfare <S%H7965><s%>; and they came <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> into the tent <S%H168><s%>.

And Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> told <S%H5608><s%> <S%H8762><s%> his father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%> all that the YY <S%H3068><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> unto Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> and to the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%> for Yisra'EL's <S%H3478><s%> sake <S%H182><s%>, and all the travail <S%H8513><s%> that had come <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8804><s%> upon them by the way <S%H1870><s%>, and how the YY <S%H3068><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8686><s%> them.

And Yitro <S%H3503><s%> rejoiced <S%H2302><s%> <S%H8799><s%> for all the goodness <S%H2896><s%> which the YY <S%H3068><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> to Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%>, whom he had delivered <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8689><s%> out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>.

And Yitro <S%H3503><s%> said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, Blessed <S%H1288><s%> <S%H8803><s%> be the YY <S%H3068><s%>, who hath delivered <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8689><s%> you out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>, and out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%>, who hath delivered <S%H5337><s%> <S%H8689><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> from under the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Egyptians <S%H4714><s%>.

Now I know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> that the YY <S%H3068><s%> is greater <S%H1419><s%> than all 'elohim <S%H430><s%>: for in the thing <S%H1697><s%> wherein they dealt proudly <S%H2102><s%> <S%H8804><s%> he was above them.

And Yitro <S%H3503><s%>, Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, took <S%H3947><s%> <S%H8799><s%> a burnt offering <S%H5930><s%> and sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> for 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>: and Aharon <S%H175><s%> came <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and all the elders <S%H2205><s%> of Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%>, to eat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8800><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> with Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

And it came to pass on the morrow <S%H4283><s%>, that Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> sat <S%H3427><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to judge <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8800><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%>: and the people <S%H5971><s%> stood <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8799><s%> by Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> from the morning <S%H1242><s%> unto the evening <S%H6153><s%>.

And when Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> all that he did <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8802><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%>, he said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, What is this thing <S%H1697><s%> that thou doest <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8802><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%>? why sittest <S%H3427><s%> <S%H8802><s%> thou thyself alone, and all the people <S%H5971><s%> stand <S%H5324><s%> <S%H8737><s%> by thee from morning <S%H1242><s%> unto even <S%H6153><s%> ?

And Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto his father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, Because the people <S%H5971><s%> come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto me to enquire <S%H1875><s%> <S%H8800><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>:

When they have a matter <S%H1697><s%>, they come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8802><s%> unto me; and I judge <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8804><s%> between one <S%H376><s%> and another <S%H7453><s%>, and I do make them know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8689><s%> the statutes <S%H2706><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, and his Torahs <S%H8451><s%>.

And Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> ' father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%> said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto him, The thing <S%H1697><s%> that thou doest <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8802><s%> is not good <S%H2896><s%>.

Thou wilt surely <S%H5034><s%> <S%H8800><s%> wear away <S%H5034><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, both thou, and this people <S%H5971><s%> that is with thee: for this thing <S%H1697><s%> is too heavy <S%H3515><s%> for thee; thou art not able <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to perform <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8800><s%> it thyself alone.

Hearken <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8798><s%> now unto my voice <S%H6963><s%>, I will give thee counsel <S%H3289><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> shall be <S%H1961><s%> <S%H8798><s%> with thee: Be thou for the people <S%H5971><s%> to 'Elohim-ward <S%H4136><s%> <S%H430><s%>, that thou mayest bring <S%H935><s%> <S%H8689><s%> the causes <S%H1697><s%> unto 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>:

And thou shalt teach <S%H2094><s%> <S%H8689><s%> <S%H853><s%> them ordinances <S%H2706><s%> and Torahs <S%H8451><s%>, and shalt shew <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8689><s%> them the way <S%H1870><s%> wherein they must walk <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and the work <S%H4639><s%> that they must do <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

Moreover thou shalt provide <S%H2372><s%> <S%H8799><s%> out of all the people <S%H5971><s%> able <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H582><s%>, such as fear <S%H3373><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, men <S%H582><s%> of truth <S%H571><s%>, hating <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8802><s%> covetousness <S%H1215><s%>; and place <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8804><s%> such over them, to be rulers <S%H8269><s%> of thousands <S%H505><s%>, and rulers <S%H8269><s%> of hundreds <S%H3967><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of fifties <S%H2572><s%>, and rulers <S%H8269><s%> of tens <S%H6235><s%>:

And let them judge <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> at all seasons <S%H6256><s%>: and it shall be, that every great <S%H1419><s%> matter <S%H1697><s%> they shall bring <S%H935><s%> <S%H8686><s%> unto thee, but every small <S%H6996><s%> matter <S%H1697><s%> they shall judge <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: so shall it be easier <S%H7043><s%> <S%H8685><s%> for thyself, and they shall bear <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the burden with thee.

If thou shalt do <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%>, and 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> command <S%H6680><s%> <S%H8765><s%> thee so, then thou shalt be able <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8804><s%> to endure <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, and all this people <S%H5971><s%> shall also go <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to their place <S%H4725><s%> in peace <S%H7965><s%>.

So Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> hearkened <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to the voice <S%H6963><s%> of his father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, and did <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> all that he had said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>.

And Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> chose <S%H977><s%> <S%H8799><s%> able <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H582><s%> out of all Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%>, and made <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them heads <S%H7218><s%> over the people <S%H5971><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of thousands <S%H505><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of hundreds <S%H3967><s%>, rulers <S%H8269><s%> of fifties <S%H2572><s%>, and rulers <S%H8269><s%> of tens <S%H6235><s%>.

And they judged <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> at all seasons <S%H6256><s%>: the hard <S%H7186><s%> causes <S%H1697><s%> they brought <S%H935><s%> <S%H8686><s%> unto Mosheh <S%H4872><s%>, but every small <S%H6996><s%> matter <S%H1697><s%> <S%H1992><s%> they judged <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8799><s%> themselves.
And Mosheh <S%H4872><s%> let his father in Torah <S%H2859><s%> <S%H8802><s%> depart <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8762><s%>; and he went <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his way into his own land <S%H776><s%>.
